page.title: 11The Tourist Industry
page.content: Cornwall is visited regularly by many holidaymakers who visit not only the beaches but inland areas. The agricultural nature of this area is attractive to tourists and in the summer there are more cars on the roads and lanes than at any other time of the year. Some people stay in the local hotel or in bed and breakfast accommodation or even camp in the farmer's fields. There are no amusement arcades, cinemas or public entertainment places but people come to see the attractive rural buildings or countryside and drive down the narrow lanes with the hedgerows full of primroses, bluebells and, later on, foxgloves. Many people are involved in tourism in some way,either working to provide bed & breakfast accommodation or selling the many items required by visitors. (Sue Hall)
